arm_group.description: healthy women PCOS Endometriosis hyperprolactinemia fertility treatment

brief_summary.textblock: Development of a bio-mathematical model of the human female cycle

clinical_study.brief_title: Mathematical Model for the Human Menstrual Cycle, Endocrinological Diseases and Fertility Treatment-PAEON

detailed_description.textblock:
From hormonal measurements throughout 1-2 menstrual cycles in women with and without
      endocrinological pathology a mathematical model of the human menstrual cycle will be
      generated. The model will serve to predict development of the cycle including ovulation as
      well as to better understand the pathophysiology of endocrinological disorder. In a second
      step current treatment protocols for fertility treatment will be integrated into the model
      in order to optimize treatment outcome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

        - Women during their reproductive phase, no hormonal therapy

        Exclusion criteria:

        - Amenorrhoae

study_pop.textblock: Women with normal and distrubed menstrual cycles Women receiving fertility treatment

facility.name: University Hospital Zurich, Division of Reproductive Endocrinology

clinical_study.official_title: Model Driven Computation for Infertility Related Endocrinological Diseases - PAEON

other_outcome.description: To better understand the pathophysiological mechanisms in endocrinological diseases

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Zurich, Division of Reproductive Endocrinology

primary_outcome.description: Development of a mathematical model of the menstrual cycle

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Mathematical model to improve fertility treatments
